text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot thai kitchen so today 
I have yet another super addictive snack recipe to

share with you so this recipe the inspiration came 
from this dim sum place in Bangkok some of you may

remember I posted a video blog about it recently 
and if you miss it I will post a link right up

here one of the things they had on the menu and 
one things they were famous for was these crispy

tofu bites and they were so simple yet so good and 
a lot of you asked for a recipe for and I thought

you know what this seems doable so I gave it a 
try tweaked it several times and now I think I

finally gotten a really really good recipe so I'm 
ready to share it with you let's get started now

the choice of tofu is pretty important you want 
something that's soft but I find softer silken

tofu is too hard to work with so I think medium 
firm is perfect and if you can get something

that's called smooth tofu or medium firm smooth 
tofu that's even better it's got a nicer texture

and what I like to do is see how this part is not 
nice and squared I trim that off and I save it to

put into my smoothie soft tofu like soft ish tofu 
and smoothies is perfect so that then when I cut

them I get nice little cubes like this I want to 
make sure the tofu itself has some flavor so what

I'm going to do is I'm going to soak it in a soy 
sauce solution so I'm going to cover it with water

get in there and then some soy sauce and so this 
way you make sure that all the tofu is equally

seasoned if you just put some voice-off on it all 
the soy sauce pools at the bottom and then the

bottom we really salty so this I find is the most 
effective way and we're just going to let this sit

for about 20 minutes this matters to the size of 
your tofu so at about 15 minutes I probably give

one a taste and see how it's where it's at see 
if you need more time or if that's enough okay

so while that's soaking I'm going to make all the 
seasoning bits that are around the tofu so I've

got some salt here and for this you want fine salt 
no kosher no course salt because asters going to

kind of fall off the tofu and it won't cling I'm 
going to add just a little sugar to help balance

of saltiness he necesito key it's a little salty a 
little sweet that's when it's so addictive and for

a little heat I'm going to add some white pepper 
and I'm using ground white pepper which is very

fine so it mixes in well with the seasoning and 
that's it it's super simple I mean if you want

to spice this up you can add five-five powder 
that will be really really good as well this is

the next part I'm going to make some garlic and 
chilies which are going to saute and then toss it

together with the tofu and it is going to put this 
dish over the top so I've got here some garlic

then I'm going to crush just so they're broken 
but I don't want to chop them because I like the

unevenness of the garlic and that's it you just 
want big chunky bits of garlic so that you can

eat pieces of garlic with the tofu it's going to 
be so good this part is optional you don't want to

make it spicy you can omit it but I'm going to 
add some sauteed chilies with the garlic and I

like to use the green Serrano you can do jalapenos 
because it's not too spicy so you can actually eat

whole pieces of it and adds a nice color to it 
and I'm just going to do oh no I'm not going to

use this nice I'm going to move five minute even 
and it will get thinner once you sautee it so you

I like to do it a little thicker than I want it to 
be in the end all right so that can go in the same

Bowl as the garlic and then one more than going 
to add to this is some green onions now cut the

white part on the bias and put that in with our 
garlic and chilies get that saute it nice and soft

because the white part is a little more pungent 
right so you don't want to eat that completely

raw and then the green part I'll chop up and keep 
separate so that we can sprinkle it on at the end

this thing is incredibly sharp for something that 
looks kind of like a toy okay let's see where our

tofu is at again you want to taste the tofu and 
make sure that it is seasoned just to be a little

salty mmm perfect now before I read it I'm going 
to just drain all of this out first because I

don't want it to keep sitting in there and getting 
saltier and saltier so standard breading many of

you probably know it's flour egg and breadcrumbs 
right I'm actually going to skip the flour for

this because I will double bread crumb it and the 
flour I find is not necessary and it also makes

it a little thicker than I like it if you like 
a really thick coating or if your tofu is bigger

than sure you can definitely add the flour it also 
makes the whole thing so much easier right so I've

got an egg here that I've beaten quite well make 
sure there's no gloopy white streaks but I'm going

to add just a splash of water because I find 
that it thins out the egg and it prevents those

gloopy thick bits that then gums up your bread 
crumb and whatever yeah there we go so for this

I am using fine bread crumbs so this is western 
style bread crumbs who don't get panko or Asian

style breadcrumbs it's gonna you know go to be a 
different look the smooth look is what we're going

for here season this a little with black pepper 
I just find that it creates some specks of black

pepper which makes it look extra delicious and if 
you can't find fine breadcrumbs you can definitely

dry the bread and blitz it in the food processor 
yourself at home that all this is anyway my only

trick for you is keep your wet hand wet and keep 
your dry hand dry that's how you prevent gunky

hands at the end of the day and then make sure you 
don't have any dripping bits of egg before you put

in the breadcrumb because that's going to drip in 
the breadcrumbs and then it dumps it up and you

end up wasting a lot of breadcrumb that way into 
the breadcrumb and right away you want to toss it

in the breadcrumbs and like that the code number 
one it's very thin we're going to do this twice ok

so I actually did two different batches one where 
I floured egg and breadcrumb just to show you the

difference at the end you might not be able to 
see it but anyway it's per experiment but now

I have to coat it again with the eggs and bread 
crumbs because this bread crumb is so fine that

you actually need the two coating so even if you 
did flour it you still need the double coating of

the egg and bread crumbs ok so now I've got some 
frying oil in here I'm going to wait till it gets

to 350 these will literally take one minute to 
brown and you don't want to fight any longer than

that the tofu is already cooked you just trying 
to get the outside to brown if if you leave it

there too long what could happen is it builds up 
so much pressure inside and it breaks the shell I

usually end up with like four pieces per best and 
ends up breaking and you'll be able to hear it as

soon as it breaks in a go ping ding ding moving 
because the water from the tofu comes out so that

happens just find the culprit and fish it out so 
I just finished frying and just want to show you

the differences real quick of what happened here 
so this is the one that I did not flour it's got

a nice coating on it but it's a thinner softer 
coating this is the one that I did flour it's a

firmer thicker coating so at the end of the day I 
guess it depends on what you like but I will show

you this this is what I'm talking about look at 
this one look how crazy this is this completely

just spat out the tofu from its shell and there's 
a complete shell and the tofu they just came out

this is never happen through your force was really 
funny I'm guessing this is a thin bit a few others

broke but didn't come out so this happens you know 
occasionally I've got a couple of pieces like that

I find that the ones with the flour will not break 
as easily because the coating is thicker but then

but then I prefer the thinness of this kind of 
coating so you know you just kind of choose your

VAT oh honey all right we're almost done I've got 
a wok here was just a little bit of oil in it this

right here is the icing on the cake I'm telling 
you oh also I want to add a few pieces of red

pepper just for color you don't have to of you 
don't have any and we keep the heat pretty low

so that the garlic can have time to soften before 
it starts browning and you just want enough oil

to lubricate it because we're going to toss the 
tofu with all of this so you don't want to get at

any oil year than it needs to be okay Oh once you 
start to smell chillies in the air you've got some

Brown nice bits on the garlic the garlic looks 
translucent I'm going to turn off the heat give

the tofu a toss in with all of this good stuff 
whoo-hoo and this is why you don't really want

it boy Lee but I do want because there's so much 
flavorful oil in that pan I do want this whole

food is sort of like rub against it and and get 
some of that flavor on now the seasoning I don't

want to toss it in here because the pan is really 
oily if I sprinkle all the sugar and salt in

here it's all going to get stuck to the pan like 
nothing will go under the tofu you actually want

to move it into a mixing bowl give it a sprinkle 
and I'll do most of it but not everything and then

give it a quick pot it's also much easier to toss 
in a Boldin in the wok woohoo and then the green

onions go in I look like the party or what what 
and that's it there's your party snack you know

one thing you'll have a hard time with is stopping 
yourself from eating it all before you play this

so the secret is I want to arrange this hole on 
the plate first before I put all the little bits

leave the little bits on top so people can see 
it oh yeah that's like the icing on the cake all

right so the trick with this is you actually you 
definitely want a piece of garlic or chili or one

of these topping things on the piece of tofu 
oh that smell is so good it's so munching the

coating doesn't actually become like crispy crispy 
but it's just enough of a crust to contrast the

creaminess of the tofu and that garlic oh my god 
that garlic and salty sweet not too salty which is

dangerous because that means you can really just 
kind of go crazy on it like I have a really hard

time stopping these and these are vegetarian 
so it's definitely a great great hearty snack

a little bit of work with the breading you know 
how I feel about threading and and things like

that yeah it's a bit of okay but at the end it 
is so so worth it so the recipe as always will

be alpha PI system calm when you make it send me
